revision.text:
{{Infobox musical artist | | image = Ryan Shore 3.jpg | image_size = 200 | background = non_performing_personnel | name = Ryan Shore | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1974|12|29|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]] | death_date = | occupation = Composer, songwriter, conductor, music producer | years_active = | genre = [[Film score]] | website = {{url|www.ryanshore.com}} }} '''Ryan Shore''' (born 29 December 1974 in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]]) is a Canadian [[composer]], [[songwriter]], and [[music director]] for [[film composer|film]], [[Television show|television]], [[virtual reality]], [[Albums|records]], [[Video game composer|games]], [[concerts]], and [[theater]]. He is a graduate of the [[Berklee College of Music]].{{cite news |last=Small |first=Mark |title= Looking for Challenges |url=http://www.berklee.edu/bt/berklee-today-spring-2012/ryan-shore |publisher=Berklee College of Music |date=Spring 2012}} ==Music career== Shore was Assistant Music Director and Contributing Composer / Arranger / Orchestrator for the 87th [[Academy Awards]], where he worked with artists [[Lady Gaga]], [[John Legend]], [[Adam Levine]], [[Anna Kendrick]], [[Common (rapper)|Common]], [[Tim McGraw]], [[Jack Black]], [[Neil Patrick Harris]], and [[Jennifer Hudson]]. Shore’s composing credits include [[Star Wars Forces of Destiny|Star Wars: Forces of Destiny]] ([[Lucasfilm]]), [[Julie's Greenroom]] ([[Netflix]]) starring [[Julie Andrews]] with all new puppets from the [[Jim Henson Company]], [[Penn Zero: Part-Time Hero|Penn Zero: Part Time Hero]] ([[Disney]]), [[Scooby-Doo! WrestleMania Mystery]] ([[Warner Bros]]), [[Scooby-Doo! and WWE: Curse of the Speed Demon]] ([[Warner Bros]]),{{cite web|url=http://filmmusicdaily.com/2016/07/28/scooby-doo-wwe-demon-ryan-shore/|title=Gangway! Get Ready for Ryan Shore's Score to 'Scooby Doo! And WWE: Curse Of the Speed Demon'! Watch the Animated Hijinks on Digital August 9|publisher=filmmusicdaily.com}} [[R.L. Stine's Monsterville: Cabinet of Souls]] ([[Universal Studios|Universal]])([[Emmy Award]] nomination, Outstanding Music Direction and Composition),{{cite news|url=http://www.axs.com/interview-emmy-award-nominated-composer-ryan-shore-82841|title=Interview: Emmy Award-nominated composer Ryan Shore|last=Frederick|first=Brittany|date=April 28, 2016}} [[Spy Hunter]] ([[Warner Bros]]),{{cite news|url=http://www.classicalmpr.org/story/2012/10/19/ryan-shore-spy-hunter-top-score-henry-mancini|title=Spy Hunter Gets New Soundtrack by Ryan Shore|last=Reese|first=Emily|work=ClassicalMPR.org |publisher=Minnesota Public Radio|accessdate=2012-10-19}} [[The Shrine (film)|The Shrine]] ([[Grammy Award]] nomination, Best Score) [[Prime (film)|Prime]] ([[Universal Studios|Universal]]) starring [[Meryl Streep]], Cop and a Half: New Recruit (Universal), [[Harvard Man]] ([[Lions Gate]]), [[The Girl Next Door (2007 film)|The Girl Next Door]] ([[Anchor Bay Entertainment|Anchor Bay]]). He also composed on-camera music for ''[[Fur (film)|Fur]]'', starring [[Nicole Kidman]] and [[Robert Downey, Jr.]], and was seen in the film performing his original music. Shore has conducted orchestras around the world in recordings and concerts including The [[New York Philharmonic]], The [[Hollywood Symphony Orchestra]], The Skywalker Symphony Orchestra, The [[Czech Philharmonic]], as well as conducting concerts for [[Pokémon: Symphonic Evolutions]] and Soundtracks Live! featuring music from [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]]. Shore's [[Broadway theater|Broadway]] and theater credits include orchestrations and arrangements for Broadway concerts starring [[Tony Award]] winners [[Sutton Foster]], [[Idina Menzel]], [[Whoopi Goldberg]], [[Matthew Broderick]], [[Kristin Chenoweth]], [[Heather Headley]], and [[Faith Prince]], as well as music directing the Los Angeles production of [[Heathers: The Musical]], directed by [[Andy Fickman]].{{cite news |last=Snetiker |first=Marc |title=Heathers the Musical, Based on the ‘80s Movie, Set for World Premiere in Los Angeles |url=http://www.broadway.com/buzz/171449/heathers-the-musical-based-on-the-80s-movie-set-for-world-premiere-in-los-angeles/ |publisher=Broadway.com |date=August 29, 2013}}{{cite news |last=Ehren |first=Christine |title=Film and Broadway Stars to Shine at "First Your Dream" Benefit June 12 |url=http://www.playbill.com/article/film-and-broadway-stars-to-shine-at-first-you-dream-benefit-june-12-com-89423 |publisher=Playbill.com |date=May 23, 2000}} Shore plays saxophone and has performed with artists including [[John Williams]], [[Matchbox Twenty]], [[Barry Manilow]], [[Johnny Mathis]], [[Natalie Cole]], [[Dave Koz]], [[Arturo Sandoval]], [[Gerry Mulligan]], [[Ana Gasteyer]], [[Mark Ballas]], and [[Clark Terry]].{{cite web|url=https://www.classic107.com/news/composer-and-conductor-ryan-shore-is-sarah-jo-s-guest-in-the-diamond-lane-thursday/ |title= Composer and Conductor Ryan Shore in the Diamond Lane |publisher= classic107.com |date= |accessdate=January 17, 2017}} ==Awards== ===Emmy Awards=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" | Event ! scope="col" | Award ! scope="col" | Title ! scope="col" | Result |- ! scope="row" | 2016 | [[Emmy Awards]] | Outstanding Music Direction and Composition | [[R.L. Stine's Monsterville: Cabinet of Souls]] | {{nom}} |- ! scope="row" | 2013 | [[Emmy Awards]] | Outstanding Promotional Announcement | ''[[P.O.V.]]'' | {{nom}} |} ===Grammy Awards=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" | Event ! scope="col" | Award ! scope="col" | Title ! scope="col" | Result |- ! scope="row" | 2012 | [[Grammy Awards]] | Best Score Soundtrack | ''[[The Shrine (film)|The Shrine]]'' | {{nom}} |} {{cite web|url=https://www.pbs.org/pov/blog/pressroom/2013/07/pov-films-nominated-for-9-news-documentary-emmy-awards/|title=POV Films Nominated for 9 News & Documentary Emmy Awards|work=pbs.org|publisher=PBS|accessdate=2013-07-12}} ==Personal life== Ryan Shore is the nephew of film composer [[Howard Shore]].{{cite web|url=http://www.awardsdaily.com/tv/interview-ryan-shore/ |title= Ryan Shore Discusses Composing, Influences |publisher= awardsdaily.com |date= |accessdate=March 19, 2016}}
Ryan Shore is a certified [[private pilot]].{{cite web|url=http://perspectiveforum.net/2017/07/07/ryan-shore// |title= Perspective: A Forum for Film, TV, and Media Composers |publisher= perspectiveforum.net |date= |accessdate=July 7, 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://www.ascap.com/playback/2013/03/wecreatemusic/fmf-ryan-shore-on-mindless-behavior-all-around-the-world.aspx// |title= Ryan Shore on Mindless Behavior: All Around the World |publisher= ascap.com |date= |accessdate= March 15, 2013}} ==Discography== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" | Title ! scope="col" | Label |- ! scope="row" | 2017 | '''Tiny Christmas''' | [[Varèse Sarabande|Varese Sarabande]] |- ! scope="row" | 2017 | '''Cop and a Half: New Recruit''' | [[Back Lot Music]] |- ! scope="row" | 2017 | '''Julie's Greenroom''' | [[Varèse Sarabande|Varese Sarabande]] |- ! scope="row" | 2016 | '''Scooby-Doo! and WWE: Curse of the Speed Demon''' | [[Lakeshore Records]] |- ! scope="row" | 2016 | '''Floyd Norman: An Animated Life''' | Ryan Shore Records |- ! scope="row" | 2015 | '''R.L. Stine's Monsterville: Cabinet of Souls''' | [[Back Lot Music]] |- ! scope="row" | 2015 | '''Confession''' | [[La-La Land Records]] |- ! scope="row" | 2014 | '''Drew: The Man Behind The Poster''' | Ryan Shore Records |- ! scope="row" | 2012 | '''Peter Gunn''' (Spy Hunter) | [[WaterTower Music]] |- ! scope="row" | 2011 | '''The Shrine''' | Screamworks |- ! scope="row" | 2010 | '''Offspring''' | Ryan Shore Records |- ! scope="row" | 2010 | '''Vulgar''' | OCF Records |- ! scope="row" | 2010 | '''Rising Stars''' | Doberman Entertainment |- ! scope="row" | 2009 | '''Rex Steele: Nazi Smasher and Other Short Film Scores by Ryan Shore''' | [[MovieScore Media]] |- ! scope="row" | 2009 | '''Shadows''' | [[MovieScore Media]] |- ! scope="row" | 2008 | '''Jack Brooks: Monster Slayer: Special Surround Edition''' | [[MovieScore Media]] |- ! scope="row" | 2008 | '''Jack Brooks: Monster Slayer''' | [[MovieScore Media]] |- ! scope="row" | 2008 | '''Numb/Kettle of Fish/Coney Island Baby''' | [[MovieScore Media]] |- ! scope="row" | 2007 | '''The Girl Next Door''' | [[MovieScore Media|Film Music Downloads]] |- ! scope="row" | 2006 | '''Headspace''' | [[MovieScore Media|Film Music Downloads]] |- ! scope="row" | 2005 | '''Prime''' | [[Varèse Sarabande|Varese Sarabande]] |- |} http://www.filmmusicdaily.com/?s=ryan+shore http://moviescoremedia.com/?s=ryan+shore&searchsubmit=Search {{cite web|url=http://www.watertower-music.com/releases/release.php?title=spyhunter |title=Spy Hunter: Original Video Game Soundtrack |publisher=WaterTower Music |date=2012-10-09 |accessdate=2017-07-21}} {{cite web|url=http://www.cduniverse.com/search/xx/music/artist/Ryan+Shore/a/albums.htm |title=Ryan Shore Discography at CD Universe |publisher=Cduniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2017-07-21}} {{cite web|author=Varèse Sarabande |url=http://www.varesesarabande.com/products/prime |title=Prime | Varèse Sarabande |publisher=Varesesarabande.com |date= |accessdate=2017-07-21}} {{cite web|url=http://www.lalalandrecords.com/Site/Confession.html |title=film music | movie music| film score | Confession - Ryan Shore - Limited Edition |publisher=Lalalandrecords.com |date= |accessdate=2017-07-21}} {{cite web|url=http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/ryanshore6 |title=Ryan Shore | Confession (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack) | CD Baby Music Store |publisher=Cdbaby.com |date= |accessdate=2017-07-21}} {{cite web|author=Varèse Sarabande |url=https://www.varesesarabande.com/products/julies-greenroom |title=Julie's Greenroom | Varèse Sarabande |publisher=Varesesarabande.com |date=2017-03-29 |accessdate=2017-07-21}} {{cite web|url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2015/09/10/r-l-stines-monsterville-cabinet-of-souls-soundtrack-details/ |title=‘R.L. Stine’s Monsterville: Cabinet of Souls’ Soundtrack Details |publisher=Film Music Reporter |date= |accessdate=2017-07-21}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== * {{officialwebsite|www.ryanshore.com}} * {{Facebook user|ryanshoremusic}} * {{Twitter}} *{{IMDb name|id=0003972|name=Ryan Shore}} *[{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p397796|pure_url=yes}} Ryan Shore at Allmusic.com] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shore, Ryan}} [[Category:1974 births]] [[Category:Berklee College of Music alumni]] [[Category:Canadian conductors (music)]] [[Category:Canadian film score composers]] [[Category:Canadian jazz saxophonists]] [[Category:Canadian Jews]] [[Category:Canadian record producers]] [[Category:Canadian songwriters]] [[Category:Canadian television composers]] [[Category:Jewish Canadian musicians]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Male film score composers]] [[Category:Male television composers]] [[Category:Video game composers]]
